metadata.case_name: Appellant v. Respondent No. 1 (Bargi Constituency Election)

facts.text: Polling for election to Madhya Pradesh Legislative Assembly from Bargi constituency taken on March 9, 1957; result declared on March 12, 1957.
Appellant secured 9308 votes, respondent 1 secured 8019 votes, respondent 2 secured 3210 votes.
Respondent 1 filed election petition No. I of 1957 before Election Commission, New Delhi, praying declaration that appellant's election void and respondent 1 duly elected.
Petition entrusted to Election Tribunal, Jabalpur for trial.
On October 12, 1957, appellant filed objection under s.90(3) RPA 1951 alleging non-compliance with s.117 by respondent 1; prayed for dismissal of petition.
Respondent 1 disputed allegations, urged no justification for dismissal under s.90(3).
Election Tribunal by order dated December 5, 1957 held s.117 mandatory and not complied with; allowed appellant's application, dismissed petition under s.90(3).
Respondent 1 preferred appeal to Madhya Pradesh High Court (First Appeal No. 141 of 1957) on December 27, 1957 against Tribunal's order.
In High Court, appellant urged preliminary objection that appeal incompetent under s.116A RPA; overruled.
High Court on merits held substantial compliance with s.117; set aside Tribunal's order dated March 8, 1958, remanded petition for disposal according to law.
Appellant applied to High Court for certificate of fitness on February 22, 1958; dismissed.
Supreme Court granted special leave to appeal on April 14, 1958.

Respondent 1 deposited Rs.1000 security via Government Treasury Receipt in name of A. P. Shiv Prasad Chanpuria on account 'Security deposits for Election Petition of Bargi Assembly Constituency No. 97... Refundable by order of the Election Commission of India, New Delhi.'

legal_issues.text: Whether appeal to High Court competent against order dismissing election petition under s.90(3) RPA 1951, or is it only appealable if under s.98.
Whether respondent 1 complied with provisions of s.117 RPA 1951 regarding security deposit.

petitioner_arguments.text: Impugned order passed under s.90(3); no appeal provided under s.116A which only allows appeals from orders under s.98, s.99.
Dismissal not at conclusion of trial, hence not under s.98; s.90(3) order on preliminary point not appealable.
Respondent 1 did not comply with s.117: deposit not in favour of Secretary to Election Commission; conditioned 'refundable by order of Election Commission', preventing payment to appellant as costs.

respondent_arguments.text: Impugned order in substance and law under s.98, hence appealable under s.116A.
Substantial compliance with s.117; technical defects should not lead to dismissal.

court_reasoning.text: Order under s.90(3) is part of trial commencing from reference under s.86; dismissal on preliminary objection concludes trial, hence in substance under s.98(a); appealable under s.116A.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Trial means entire proceedings before tribunal from transfer under s.86 until award.

court_reasoning.text: Scheme of Ch. III Pt. VI RPA: post-s.85 scrutiny by Election Commission, all proceedings including s.90(3) dismissal part of trial; supported by ss.103,106,107,99.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Order under s.90(3) deemed under s.98; later clarified by explanation added by Act 58 of 1958.

court_reasoning.text: s.117 not to be strictly/technically construed; substantial compliance shown; deposit for election petition credited to Election Commission account; 'refundable' no bar to payment as costs.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Security at disposal of Election Commission for proceedings.

holdings.text: Order dismissing petition under s.90(3) deemed made under s.98(a); appeal lies to High Court under s.116A.
Substantial compliance with s.117 where deposit made for security of petition and credited to Election Commission account.

precedents_cited.case_name: Harish Chandra Bajpai v. Triloki Singh
precedents_cited.relevance: Trial means entire proceedings before tribunal from s.86 transfer until award.
Order under s.90(3) in substance under s.98.
s.117 not strictly construed; substantial compliance suffices, no dismissal on technical grounds.

statutes_cited.name: Representation of the People Act, 1951
statutes_cited.relevance: Governs election petitions, trial procedure, security deposit, appeals; s.90(3) dismissal deemed under s.98 for appealability; substantial compliance with s.117.

statutes_cited.name: Act 58 of 1958
statutes_cited.relevance: Clarifies s.90(3) order deemed under s.98(a); deletes reference to Secretary in s.117.

outcome.summary: Appeal dismissed; High Court's order upheld holding appeal competent and substantial compliance with s.117; election petition remanded to Tribunal for disposal according to law.
outcome.relief_granted: Election petition revived and remanded to Election Tribunal, Jabalpur.

key_quotes.text: "the trial is used as meaning the entire proceedings before the tribunal from the time the petition is transferred to it under s. 86 until the pronouncement of the award."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Defines scope of 'trial' for appealability under s.98.

key_quotes.text: "s.117 should not be strictly or technically construed and that wherever it is shown that there has been a substantial compliance with its requirements the tribunal should not dismiss the election petition under s. 90, sub-s. 3 on technical grounds."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Establishes substantial compliance test for s.117.

key_quotes.text: "an order of the tribunal dismissing an election petition under this sub-section shall be deemed to be an order made under cl. (a) of s. 98."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Quotes explanation added by Act 58 of 1958 clarifying appealability.
